metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2765 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ModSecurity module before 2.7.4 for the Apache HTTP Server allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference, process crash, and disk consumption) via a POST request with a large body and a crafted Content-Type header.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2765` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-security2 - 2.7.7-2
libapache2-modsecurity - 2.7.7-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: modsecurity-apache package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.7-2').
